intro: Psephellus mucroniferus, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with trifoliate or pinnate structures, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
